message:
Palestinian channels report 23 deaths in IDF attacks in Rafah since the morning hours (not official sources).

##
Presumably this includes the 15 dead from the night
event_breakdown:
- Palestinian channels report 23 deaths in IDF attacks in Rafah since the morning hours
- 15 dead from the night in IDF attacks in Rafah

message:
Germany: German police disperse (resolutely) a camp with anti-Israeli demonstrators at the University of Berlin that was established against the background of the war in Gaza.
The protesters call out to the police:
Shame, shame, shame!
location:
The main location where the event unfolds is the University of Berlin, specifically in Germany's capital city. This prestigious institution serves as the backdrop for a contentious gathering of anti-Israeli demonstrators amid the backdrop of the conflict in Gaza. Within the confines of this academic enclave, tensions run high as protesters voice their discontent, echoing their grievances against the ongoing situation.

The University of Berlin stands as a beacon of intellect and discourse, but on this occasion, it becomes a focal point for activism and dissent. Amidst the imposing architecture and bustling campus life, the clash of ideologies takes center stage. The demonstrators, motivated by their convictions, make their voices heard, calling out to the authorities in protest.

Within the confines of this urban landscape, the clash between protesters and law enforcement symbolizes a broader societal divide, reflecting the complexities of global politics and the pursuit of justice. As the events unfold, the University of Berlin emerges as a microcosm of larger geopolitical tensions, where voices clamor for recognition and change.
event_breakdown:
- German police disperse anti-Israeli demonstrators at the University of Berlin
- Anti-Israeli demonstration camp established against the background of the war in Gaza at the University of Berlin
- Protesters calling out "Shame, shame, shame!" to the police

message:
Hezbollah has recently accepted responsibility for a midday drone attack that it claims was aimed at the Yiftach base and the Iron Dome batteries in Ramot Naftali.

According to unofficial sources identified with the organization, 6 drones took part in the attack.

According to the IDF spokesperson, one drone was intercepted, some fell in open areas and some caused damage, but according to him there were no casualties as a result.

###
The IDF should make Hezbollah a heavy price and react as if Hezbollah's attack had achieved its goals.
This has become a disturbing daily occurrence.
event_breakdown:
- Hezbollah claims responsibility for midday drone attack on Yiftach base and Iron Dome batteries in Ramot Naftali
- Unofficial sources report 6 drones participated in the attack
- IDF spokesperson states one drone intercepted, some fell in open areas, and some caused damage with no casualties reported
- IDF urged to react strongly to Hezbollah's attack

message:
Hamas in an official announcement: the purpose of the (Israeli) invasion into Rafah is to harm the ceasefire efforts.

###
And they still aren't announcing the suspension of talks, as they promised they would if Israel were to invade Rafah.
event_breakdown: - Hamas accuses Israel of invading Rafah to undermine ceasefire efforts

message: Palestinian channels: An Israeli drone punched a hole in the dome of the Al-Abrar Mosque in the center of Rafah.
event_breakdown: - An Israeli drone punched a hole in the dome of the Al-Abrar Mosque in the center of Rafah.

message:
The movement of displaced Gazans from Rafah to Khan Yunis continues...

Some of the displaced people who left Rafah today are setting up tents near the ruins of their homes in Khan Yunis.
event_breakdown:
1. Movement of displaced Gazans from Rafah to Khan Yunis.
2. Displaced people setting up tents near the ruins of their homes in Khan Yunis.

message:
More ridicule from Fatah-affiliated channels: "Be quite!"

Attached is an old photo of the leader of Hamas in the Gaza Strip, Yahya Sinwar, in his good old days in an Israeli prison.
event_breakdown: - old photo of the leader of Hamas in the Gaza Strip, Yahya Sinwar, in an Israeli prison

message:
Fatah-affiliated channels are mocking Hamas:

Where have all the Hamas police officers gone?
Where are they? Why are they not protecting the people? Did they just all run away?

###
The fact that the IDF managed to take control of the Rafah crossing without almost no resistance is significant. 

Many Palestinian feel that Hamas has abandoned the battlefield, not living up to the hawkish statements from its spokespeople in recent weeks.

The strategic Rafah crossing fell into the hands of the Israelis almost without a fight.
event_breakdown:
- Fatah-affiliated channels mocking Hamas for the absence of Hamas police officers
- Questioning the whereabouts and reasons for the absence of Hamas police officers
- IDF taking control of the Rafah crossing with little resistance
- Palestinian perception that Hamas has abandoned the battlefield
- The strategic Rafah crossing falling into Israeli hands almost without a fight.

message:
The Lebanese Al-Mayadeen, citing a senior member of the "Palestinian Resistance":

"The taking over of the Rafah crossing threatens the ceasefire talks. Hamas sees it as a deliberate provocation with the aim of creating difficulties in negotiations."

###
And yet... despite past promises... Hamas has not stopped the negotiations.
This shows that it has a lot to lose from a full-out military operation in Rafah. 
Hamas was bluffing, and its hand was exposed.

The Palestinian Crossings Authority: 

Rafah crossing officials left the area before the arrival of Israeli forces. None of them were hurt.
event_breakdown:
1. Officials from the Palestinian Crossings Authority vacated the Rafah crossing area.
2. Israeli forces arrived at the Rafah crossing. 
3. None of the officials from the Palestinian Crossings Authority were injured during the incident.

message:
The military wing of Hamas in an official announcement: 

We launched 114mm "Rajum" short-range rockets at the Kerem Shalom crossing.

##
The Kerem Shalom crossing will likely remain closed for humanitarian aid... Hamas rocket fire puts truck drivers and others working at the crossing at risk.
event_breakdown:
1. The military wing of Hamas launched 114mm "Rajum" short-range rockets at the Kerem Shalom crossing.
2. The Kerem Shalom crossing will likely remain closed for humanitarian aid.
3. Hamas rocket fire puts truck drivers and others working at the crossing at risk.

message:
ضاع معبر فيلادلفيا يا مصريين 💔

A Palestinian channel published the attached clip with the following caption:

"The Philadelphia (Rafah - AA) crossing is lost, O Egyptians 💔"
location: Based on the information provided, the main location where the main event takes place is the Philadelphia crossing in Rafah.

message:
The military wing of Hamas: We launched rockets at the maneuvering forces inside the Rafah crossing.

##
Two things to note here:

1. Hamas officially admits that there are Israeli forces inside the Rafah crossing.
2. Hamas attacks the crossing with the aim of damaging it.
location: The main location where the main event takes place is the Rafah crossing.
event_breakdown: - Hamas launches rockets at Israeli forces inside the Rafah crossing

message: Additional photos published by the IDF spokesman from the Rafah crossing.

The IDF reports that it had eliminated 20 terrorists and uncovered three operational tunnel shafts as part of the operation in Rafah.

Additionally, the IDF spokesman published footage of Israeli forces entering and taking control of the Rafah crossing compound.

Honestly, these are exciting sights. The Rafah crossing is the crossing through which Hamas released some of the Israeli hostages during November's Hudna. Now it's under Israeli control. 

White and blue flags - looks better this way.

Here's something important to note:

The ground operation in Rafah has begun, there is no disputing that.
There are significant achievements on the ground - the control of the Rafah crossing, there is no dispute over that either.

Despite all of this and despite explicit and public promises from senior Hamas officials that action in Rafah will cause the negotiations to stop - Hamas has not announced as of now the suspension of talks for a ceasefire deal.

This is important. The military pressure works in Israel's favor in the negotiations. This is how negotiations are conducted in the Middle East. Israel didn't play into the hands of Hamas, negotiating from a position of weakness, but rather took initiative and action - forcing Hamas, which remained stubborn in its demands throughout the recent round of talks, into a worse position to negotiate from.
Displaced residents from eastern Rafah start moving to Khan Yunis, following the beginning of the Israeli military operation in the area.
event_breakdown: - Displaced residents from eastern Rafah start moving to Khan Yunis, following the beginning of the Israeli military operation in the area.

message:
The Shiite militias in Iraq have increased the number of announcements about alleged attacks on Israeli territory.

Last night, the militias announced that they had attacked the Yehonatan and Jordan bases (in the Golan) with suicide drones. They also claim to have attacked the Sapir base early this morning.

The multitude of announcements comes against the background of the progress of the ground operation in Rafah.
event_breakdown:
1. Shiite militias in Iraq increase announcements of alleged attacks on Israeli territory.
2. Militias claim to have attacked Yehonatan and Jordan bases in the Golan with suicide drones.
3. Militias claim to have attacked Sapir base early in the morning.
4. Ground operation progresses in Rafah.

message:
The IDF spokesman announced this morning the death of two reservists, major Dan Kamkagi and major Natan Hertz, from the 6551 patrol battalion.

The two were killed in yesterday's suicide drone attack in the Metula area.

May their memory be a blessing.

The Palestinians, for their part, report 15 casualties as a result of IDF airstrikes on several houses east and west of Rafah.

Given the number of attacks by the IDF last night and considering that "the ground operation in Rafah has begun", this is a very small number of casualties. One possible reason for this could be the evacuation leaflets that have been dropped in the area in recent days.

Attached is footage of some of last night's attacks in Rafah, as photographed from the Egyptian side of the border.
event_breakdown:
- IDF airstrikes on several houses east and west of Rafah resulting in 15 Palestinian casualties
- Ground operation in Rafah begins
- Evacuation leaflets dropped in the area in recent days
- Footage of last night's attacks in Rafah photographed from the Egyptian side of the border

message:
A major Hamas oxygen pipeline has been cut off - currently, the IDF controls the Rafah crossing.

The IDF holds and fully controls one of Hamas's main power sources in recent months - the Gazan side of the Rafah crossing.

The crossing is closed to passenger traffic, and the commercial crossing is also shut for trucks carrying goods.

The attached photos are circulating on most Palestinian and Arab channels - everyone is witnessing this development!

This is an important mental and military achievement. The Israeli flag flies at the Rafah crossing.

Equally important to note is that there was no significant resistance or fighting from Hamas, and that this objective was achieved within hours of the operation's announcement.

Well done.
event_breakdown:
- Major Hamas oxygen pipeline cut off, IDF controls Rafah crossing
- IDF holds and fully controls Hamas's main power source at Rafah crossing
- Crossing closed to passenger and commercial traffic
- Photos circulating on Palestinian and Arab channels, witnessing development
- Israeli flag flies at Rafah crossing
- No significant resistance or fighting from Hamas, objective achieved within hours of operation announcement

message: The swearing-in ceremony of Putin as President of Russia for another six years has begun.
